numbered_ace_sentences: 2. In this graph, a higher percentage of 15-to-24-year-olds say that the world gets better with each generation.
3. In this graph, in India a higher percentage of people who are 40 years old or older say that the world is getting better.
4. In this graph, in Nigeria a higher percentage of people who are 40 years old or older say that the world is getting better.
5. In this graph, in Morocco a higher percentage of people who are 40 years old or older say that the world is getting better.
6. More young people say that the world is getting better than older people.
7. In this graph, there are more dots on the side of young people than on the side of older people.
8. I wonder why some people think that the world is getting better.
9. It seems to me that history repeats itself.
10. I wonder why different age groups have different opinions.
11. This relates to me and my community.
12. In my community, different people have different opinions about whether the world gets better with each generation.
13. These opinions help us see how we can help the world become better.
